text:
My daughter recently stayed for two week
She was so enthusiastic about her experience that she recommended to try Udara out 
So I asked her to sign me up
I did a total of 12 days with 5 days detox as a start
The overall experience was beyond my expectation
The staff is without exception lovely, helpful and made me feel at home and appreciated 
Always with a big warm smile
The facility is unique and has a jungle like style which brings harmony to the different aspects of wellness and spiritual activities
As I’m in my seventies I was challenged by some yoga styles .Which has motivated me to take up yoga at home
Living in Texas USA meant that I had to travel half way around the world but it was well worth it
The coordinators Marina and Violeta were very available and helpful and willing to accommodate my wishes and needs
The owner Markus is low key and constructive, open to suggestions and very approachable
The price setting is well inline with the value of the total package offered
For elderly healthy people I consider this wellness spa very suitable
As for me I plan to go back
title: Amazing experience

text:
I have just completed 10 day Juice detox at Udara, it has been a fantastic experience and I thoroughly enjoyed!
I have never done a detox or health program before. 
Healthy freshly made juices, proper hydration, spirulina and many other supplements, with plenty of massages and choice of any yoga styles for any levels (I m beginner in yoga and i felt fine!). Nutritional talk with Violetta was very helpful and motivated me to create my new healthy habits and change my lifestyle.
Rooms are clean and i loved my small green garden for relaxation and book reading.
The staff really care and always greet you well, Violetta and Martina were my detox consultants and they are fully supportive from the moment I arrive & throughout.
The weight loss is not my focus - for me it’s about intense relaxation and body cleansing. After my detox here I left feeling and looking much lighter, much fresher, my skin was glowing.
I love the atmosphere and focus on mental, emotional and physical health. I’ll be a repeat guest!
title: Amazing Detox Experience

text:
Pro: Staffs are well trained and always smiling. Yoga shala is overlooking the beach with breeze and great ocean view. Yoga class has good schedule and variety.

Cons:
Rooms: If you got assigned to the 1st floor. you either have zero privacy or no natural light. The room smells like mould on the 1st floor because all interior is made of wood. ventilation is non existent.Be prepared for a really dark room with strong smell.

Massage: When you book a massage. They put both men and women at one big open space with only thin mattress on the floor. And you are supposed to only keep your underwear for the massage. I feel super awkward the whole time. 

Security: It's a Yoga & detox. I don't carry my wallet everywhere. All my cash was gone when I realized I wanna tip the lady who gave me a body scrub. Just be careful with your belongings in this place. Whoever stole it is either with housekeeping or a staff with access to the room key because the door locks automatically after it's closed. 
When I brought it up with the hotel manager, he said I had no proof because there is no CCTV. How convenient! I booked for 5 nights and left after the 2nd night. Manager Adi promised a refund of 2 nights which I never got. 

Nobody wanna come and contribute a dime to the Bali tourism industry after being treated like this. Instead of figuring out what happened with the staff, they just deny it happened because it's bad for the hotel's reputation.
title: Security is a big issue.

owner_response.text:
Dear EmmaW3199,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. I am disappointed to read your feedback and we feel sorry that we were not able to impress you during your stay. However, I also would like to take the opportunity and clarify a few things from our side.

Thank you for the compliment given in regards of the staffs are well trained and always smiling as they are always joyful to pamper you and the Yoga Shala is overlooking to the ocean as well as huge variety of yoga class types.
In regards to the room on 1st floor, indeed it is a subjective matter, as our guests have been raving about our comfort room with fully wood and natural stone interior as well as open bathroom. It is regrettable that you feel this way as I can assure you that our Housekeeping team is proud of cleaning and preparing the room to all our guests. By that time, we offer you to move to another room on 3rd floor and it seems that you satisfied with the new room.

Furthermore, in regards to the massage area, rest assured that we often received the compliment from our dear guests about the pathway full of Bougainvillea flowers is leading you to the Sky spa on the third floor, an open-air treatment area in midst of tropical greenery with comfortable massage beds & mattresses. Furthermore, we have another option in Spa area under for completely private room with cave natural stone ambiance.

As a Wellness resort that located in a beautiful secluded area of Seseh village where the local security is always patrol during the night time and the theft until now is non-existent. As mentioned to you on site we have interrogated the HK staff who cleaned the room with you as witness and we really acts this serious by prove that we escort you to the police station. When we at the police station. First of all, there was no specific prove of your cases that can be given to the police officer and when the police officer interrogated you, you could not provide them the real data. Furthermore, you explain to the police officer with two different chronologies and they thoughts that It seems like you do some negotiation to only got their approval to provide the letter for the claim insurance. After 2 hours at the police station and did not get any police report, you decide to go back to the hotel and ask for refund of your booking from the hotel. As a good gesture we honour the refund to the same credit card that you used for the payment.

Furthermore, at the time of the check-out you were not agreed to get refund by the same credit card that you used for the payment and refused to grant to us the bank detail, it’s because you wanted to get refund from another credit card, where from our Bank company side is suggested to do refund to the same credit card account to avoid any charges back in near future and our front desk team has been informed you that the refund process is taking 14 days.

However, Udara Bali is a resort, that has many unique features, such as a steam room, sauna, a pool landscape with two big pools, including a Watsu therapy pool, which is all free to our guests. Being near the ocean is very meaningful for many of our guests, that find peace, relaxation and transformation.

Namaste and may you find more peace somewhere else! 
Adi Prasetya / Hotel Manager

text:
I have just returned from a 7 day juice detox at Udara and I am so happy I did this! The accommodation is great, I loved that the hotel is just next to the beach and as my energy was quite low  by only drinking juices it was great to go to the beach, and use the sunbeds provided by the hotel.
The detox is a very complete program, you are sometimes almost too busy :) But all is optional. For me personally I found the yoga schedule quite heavy on aerial yoga, which is not really for me, and would've loved to be able to do some more Vinyasa or Hatha. However all the classes and teacher were great. 
The spa and pool area is amazing and real cool design. Only down side is that on several days they allowed children, who weren't even staying on the property, run and scream around the spa and pool area which is not relaxing at all. 
What makes this place truly special is the incredible staff. The wellness coaches Violetta and Martina are super sweet but also really knowledgeable and helpful. The staff at the restaurant were all so sweet and helpful, especially Lisna is just the kindest person! Also a big thanks to Wim, who took us out for a morning of excursions to a temple, water temple and waterfall. He did a great job showing us and also very knowledgeable about the sights, culture and all other questions we had.
I can highly recommend staying here!
title: 7 day juice detox

text:
I recently celebrated my 50th birthday at Udara along with 22 friends from around the world.

I was looking for a local venue, that had a value fit ( eco friendly, locally sourced produce etc) and Udara was perfect.

Rebkah and Dewi were amazing, they met with me several times and took charge coordinating things, they are not event organisers, but they worked with us to ensure that things were in place.  ( We hired furniture, decorations etc) they ended up providing some lights and sound equipment.

The surprise decorations in the dining room were nothing short of magnificent, dont want to spoil it for others, but memories forever.

The location on the top deck was breathtaking.  The dining room set with one table for all of us was beautiful.

The food is magnificent, we had a number of vegans with us, who raved about how good the food was.  No red meat or poultry, which suits us fine.   It was all fresh, well prepared and delicious.  Soul food. ( It became our go to restaurant for the week)

It's important to note that Udara is a yoga retreat, and not really a party venue, this event only worked because we were respectful of Udara's values, and they fit ours too. We started early, and finished at 10;30, we tried to keep the noise down, mindful of other guests and the retreat nature of Udara. So if you want an all night rave then this is not the place for you.  it was perfect for us.
title: Thank you for an amazing event

text:
One of the best place I have stayed to! I was looking for a quiet, healthy and yoga included environment and this gem offers it all! The rooms are super comfy and every details have been thoughts - enough room in the bathroom for products and hanging stuff. Very clean and beautiful. The pool and spa are small but one of the best again with such detailed decoration and added values: scented oil to add in your sauna, meditation cave, cold plunge pool, music under water.
Yoga space is just beautiful and overlooking the ocean + another space for meditation and a platform for aerial yoga too! All included in your stay. 
Food is super healthy and tasty and very reasonably priced! Staff is friendly and very helpful.
They also have fresh juices and smoothies all day (additional to pay).
Using bamboo straws and only glass bottles in the room.

Mixed clientele which was much appreciated - single people, couples, all ages and all level of yoga! 

The more animated beach is only 15mn walk (on the beach side) and it’s a lovely walk.

The only thing I would say moving forward to keep the consistency of the theme of the property, will be to not allow children. Having them shouting and jumping in the pool while doing yoga or méditation was spoiling the whole concept! 

Thanks again for an amazing stay! I will definitely come back and try the detox.

Émilie
title: Little gem for a relaxing and active break

text:
I have stayed here two times, once in a garden room and the other time in a sea view room. Both times were wonderful. I really love the fact that the place tries to have an environmental feel to it by using bamboo straws and large water urns available. The yoga classes were led by different teachers throughout the week and were all wonderful. The water aerobics was fun. I loved the warm pool with the music. The food was excellent and reasonably priced. I was not thrilled with the once a week BBQ as it was not as good as the menu items and the amount of fish was not worth the price. The staff are incredible and responsive. You can order a massage. I had many and they were all excellent. I will be back to Udara again!

I have one big complaint which I hope will be considered: I was unhappy to see that bathrooms have thick black plastic bags in the waste baskets (which were changed out every day of my stay) rather than having waste bins that do not need a plastic bag. Also, I was surprised that the towels were changed every day and there was no card to indicate not to change the sheets or towels. I did tell the front desk which was easy enough but I resorted to not having my room cleaned everyday rather than add to the waste. Also, I regret the use of plastic bottles here. I am really concerned with all of the trash being produced in Bali and it would do a lot of good for Udara to do more to reduce its contribution to it.
title: Great yoga classes, relaxing environment

text: As a new mum, I was given the luxury of taking some much needed time to myself to pamper and stretch out my brain and body. I have been to Bali before so I wasn't guilty and bent out of shape not visiting without my husband or someone else for that matter. It's such an easy place to travel. I arranged with reception to have a car pick me up after my 30 hr travel day. he was there with a clear labelled sign. smile and all. 1.5 hrs from the airport we arrive to an incredible ocean front / sculptured yoga shala spa center. The place is hard to describe. Not kid friendly and not wheelchair accessible but exceeded all my expectations as I was solo and am able bodied. The place is quiet, friendly, clean and exactly what someone would want for culture, change and variety. At home, I would have to bounce from place to place to get the variety they offer. Ariel, Acro, Candlelight yim after dinner, Vinyasa, Yin-Vinyasa, Healing Hatha, Water Healing, Breath workshops - they have it, daily. The instructors are the real deal. Positive, engaging and diligent. Incense burns all over the property. It's tucked into a cultural village of 300, all of whom are happy you are there. Watch the fishing boats go out in the morning while you attempt to meditate before you get your morning coconut. The food, what a treat. Not a bad item. I have been sick before on my travels, and I was able to let my guard down with this place. The owner Markus wanders around, socializes and routinely eats and quality checks. What I LOVED about this place was how serene and pleasant it was to wander and do your own thing. I signed up to do a two day detox. What a great choice that was. The on site nutritionist Violetta is wonderful. Martina is incredible as well. You can do whatever you want, when you want. Nothing is off limits. Meditate all day, read, practice, sit, lounge, sun bathe, wander the community - the world is your oyster. I would HIGHLY recommend staying I this area and going into Changgu for shopping and whatever else. Come back home to quiet rice fields and smiles. They have a shuttle that leaves 3 times a days and picks up 3 times a day to Changgu. Takes 15 min to get there. You'll be happy you stayed out of town. The staff, safety, A/C, electronic door locks, the cleanliness, the services, the food, the smiling staff, the yoga variety has my 5 stars. honestly. I've travelled most of SE Asia and India. They have my heart.
title: what a tranquil space

text:
I have been back home for 2 days and I am dreaming of returning to Udara and Seseh Beach . To start I like to thank the yoga practitioners Martina & Violet and the 4 amazing Balinese men/boys whom shared their knowledge and time with us. Also the staff are helpful & friendly with an excellent knowledge of English. The architecture and design are modern adventures with sculptures and statues peeking at you. The pools are a hot one or cool one as well as a large Finnish sauna adjacent to +13C plunge pool almost like a frozen Finnish lake to plunge into ! Breakfast is plentiful , the yoga Shalas have the best ocean views and Seseh Beach is just outside your doorstep. This bach is  not a commercial tourist beach so nothing to buy here but a lovely beach walk of 20 min will take you to Echo beach and Canggu for your commercial needs. You just need to check the tides to walk through 4 washouts to reach the commercial hub by foot via beach . There are surfers , dogs and beach restaurants as you get closer to Echo Beach. This place is owned by  Martin whom I thought was a fellow traveller chatting away to guests at night and the little details makes this such a friendly welcoming place , ceramic mugs and plates, cotton serviettes , bamboo straws , Earthy open bathrooms with doors opening to a lawn where you can see the ocean . I will recommend this place to anyone liking a understated natural environment and whom do not  mind uneven surfaces and stairs without handrails . This would not be so good if you like to get sloshed at night as you need to have your wits abut you navigating the stone steps and stone flooring. 
I think German precision with Balinese flair is an excellent fusion. Suksma
title: Utopia @ Udara

text: I stayed at Udara for a couple of days which was really nice. It's just a short ride by scooter away from Canggu and located in a quiet part right on the beach. I was upgraded to a different room which was great and everyone was really welcoming, the owner Marcus as well. It's a an amazingly decorated place, the rooms are cozy, it's cool to have had an outside shower and the complimentary yoga classes are a very nice bonus. There are different pools, whirlpools, a sauna, a steaming room and a meditation room as well. It's a great place to relax, you can easily walk along the beach, watch the sunrise and the food is very tasty/healthy too. Would definitely stay again!
title: Stay at Udara

text: I’ve stayed in May two nights with my friend at udara and we loved it. The staff is very friendly, the food is delicious, the yoga classes are great and the massage is good. The location is great, close to Canggu, quiet and directly on the beach. I can highly recommend staying there and I’ll definitely turn back soon!!! The highlight is the shopping bag which we’ve got as a gift and it’s very useful for traveling.
title: Most relaxing time in a peaceful place

owner_response.text:

Thank you for 5 star review, thank you for choosing Udara Bali Yoga Detox & Spa as your holiday in bali. we are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your whole experience at Udara Bali Yoga Detox & Spa. our resort is located on the west of canggu, still traditional balinese village, which is quiet and peach full, it's perfect place to relaxing and healing program. canggu center can be reach by beach walking around 15-20 minutes. i will pass your good comments to our Udara team, look forward to welcoming you back anytime.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I only stayed one night at Udara, but it's the perfect place for anyone who loves yoga. They have classes all day every day in one of two large shalas overlooking the ocean. There are other small yoga shalas for your own practice if you wish. The pool area is incredible with fun statues all over. There are several different pools at different temperatures, including a jacuzzi and a cold plunge for after the sauna. You can even swim up to the juice bar and order a juice. It's far enough away from the main part of Canggu that it's really quiet, but easily walkable (about 15 minutes to Echo Beach). 

One thing you should know is that at least some of the bathrooms are outside of the room on your balcony, which means they're not super private (no walls from the waist up). It didn't bother me, but if it would bother you I recommend you ask for a more private bathroom. Overall, a great stay!
title: Gorgeous yoga rooms, friendly staff, amazing pools!!

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This place is amazing, a real oasis with great food, massages, and yoga. We did a five day retreat and came away fully relaxed. The people are friendly, the yoga and sound healing offerings go on all day and are appropriate for a beginner, and we enjoyed a few special community events as part of our package, which were amazingly uplifting. The design and artful architecture are just over the top as is the food package with the freshest of seafood, smoothies, juices, and vegan offerings. It was really a dream come true for us, overlooking the ocean, a beach to walk along, pools, sauna, steam, and, oh, the massages, which were part of the package, are excellent! If you are in Bali, you should experience this place. You won't regret it.
title: Dream Come True

text: Honestly, one of my favorite places in Bali. The design of the building is breathtaking. The whole place has an amazing atmosphere. Classes are fun and people are super nice. I highly highly recommend to visit :)
title: Amazing place

text: Amazing stay, everything is so different than a regular hotel you are used to, but at the same time all the space is so beautiful and relaxing. First, the location is the best, great ocean view, away from all the busy life. Second, events and yoga classes are empowering, with really good yoga teachers. Third amazing spa wellness zone and pretty good massage sessions. And not the last, the food is the best. we are vegans, and nevertheless there were so many great options to be delighted 4 times a day for 8 days.
title: If you are into yoga, this is the best hotel you should visit

text:
Thank you again for being part of the udara family once more. Normally I don’t go in the same hotel twice but here it feels like family. All the staff, teachers and people you meet are more than wonderful! The food is great, you have a huge variety diving into spa (go for the balianese massage!), just hang around or do some yoga. I’ve been here three years ago for detoxing (10 days) and this was also an outstanding experience. I loved it. Everyone is so caretaking and supportive that you feel immediately spoiled. Make sure to not miss soundheeling, arial yoga and morning meditation <3 this energy here is unique!
A place you feel like coming home and can relax / recover. Thank you udara family for taking care of me. See you soon!
title: Spoil yourself

text:
Very nice staff and competent yoga facilitators!
I loved the ecstatic dance on Sunday!
All meals were very tasty and also a visual feast.
Spa Treatments were thorough and in a fabulous environment.
I can highly recommend Udara Bali.
title: Relax in style and within budget!

text: From the excellent service, to well crafted food, yoga classes and massages, staff put in lots of effort to making sure the needs of guest is taken care of. This is just perfect on what a real break requires.
title: Fantastic resort

text:
This place is amazing if you want to practice yoga and totally unwind. The facilities are excellent, with everything you could want and more. The views from the yoga shalas are the best and being open air with birds flying past and views out to sea.
The restaurant is also excellent and the staff are really helpful and friendly.
The guest rooms are pretty basic but we spent most of our time out of the room enjoying the facilities.
title: Fantastic facilities for yoga and well-being.

text:
Just completed the magnificent 21 day New Life Transformation detox program and it was simply amazing!!
Achieved all my health goals and more.
Lost 7kg and gained lean muscle.
The juices and soups are really fulfilling and kept me going.
The owner and staff are really impressive and always so fun and happy.
The massages are the best I’ve ever had anywhere.
The yoga facilities are world class and the pools, sauna and sound healing room  are incredible.
Set in the safe, quiet rural beach setting in Seseh Beach just a little north of Canggu; I really recommend Udara for anyone looking to become happier and healthier within themselves; body and soul.
title: 21 day detox

text:
After a couple of hetic weeks travelling and partying all over bali I decided to take some time to myself and book here with Udara Yoga detox retreat. 
I’m so glad I found this hidden gem. 
The food was the best food I have had whilst in bali. The massage was also the best I have had! (I do massage myself as a job so it’s very hard to relax)
The staff was extremely friendly and helpful not to forget my room was a lovely set up onlooking the warm pool. 

Two nights of bliss peace was just what I needed. The yoga was amazing and i really enjoyed the Ariel yoga which I am now on the hunt to see where I can do it in the UK. 

Thanks again! I will definitely be back for another stay xx
title: Amazing!!

text: Udara Bali is a precious gem in the chillin area of Seseh, north of Canggu. Such an abundance of beauty and healing can be found here. The whole place is beautiful, exotic, sacred and pleasant to all senses, the best choice to calm our never system, surrender and nourish body, mind and soul, with spa, healing activities and mindful exercises. Yoga, meditation, rehabilitation, sound healing, ecstatic dance, cacao ceremonies, kirtans are some of the amazing activities they offer there.  The beach of Seseh is very calming and nurturing and is just 1 min walking from there The view from the upstairs is breathtaking, we can see a lot of the coast of Canggu and also Uluwatu from a distance. The whole staff, with no exception, is kind, genuine, warm, pure hearted, always giving and doing their best, and they feel like a big and harmonious family to me. The restaurant also offers the high quality of a metropolitan area, great variety, deliciousness and great service, plus the kindest and smiliest of waiters and waitresses. I've received great healing here and experienced great joy. If you are in Bali, take the time to visit Udara Bali, it will be a powerful and unforgettable experience!
title: Paradise in a Paradise

text: Spend some nights there during our trip around Bali. Great place to relax and practice some yoga, while enjoying the delicious food and having a massage or spent some time in the sauna. Can recommend it without any restrictions.
title: Great place to relax and detox

text: Loved our stay at Udara - such wonderful energy and beautiful attention to detail! The instructors and the staff are really lovely and friendly. The facilities are awesome  and the food is nourishing and delicious.
title: Beautiful place

text:
All I wanted is to do a bit of yoga close to the beach and I received so much more.
Udara takes the level of yoga, wellness and health to a whole new level.

Everything your heart could desire is provided for – most amazing food (delicious and with great variety of choices and no change of food preferences is too much asked for but always received with a smile from the staff )
– great yoga classes (loved Martina’s and Douglas classes and Gus made yoga a true happy experience)
– lovely massages – sauna – sound pool and not to forget their most amazing Sunday special event.

I loved all the small details they put their heart in and which makes this place very special
starting with their welcome flowers and coconut
of course a nice comfy firm mattress allowing for a good rest – great quality of shampoo and shower gel
and an AC not blasting right over your bed.
Enough sockets to charge more than just 1 device (so no need to unplug bed light to charge phone :) )
and details such as - no plastic straws or paper napkins and providing water refill stations vs plastic bottles

From the beginning to the end they made you feel like you are not just here for holidays but part of the Udara family .
title: Perfect place to relax

text: Udara Bali is an amazing little yoga retreat/hotel/spa. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Canggu, it offers a idyllic venue for some rest and recuperation with amazing events/ experiences. The food, room, staff were all fantastic and I would highly recommend. I particularly enjoyed their Udara Sunday programme, what an experience.
title: Fantastic hidden gem

text: I was looking to unwind and chose the juice detox package, something I find very difficult to go thru at home with hectic everyday life. Udara is a perfect place for that, they have thought of every detail. Plenty of yoga classes in open air, the waves hitting the shore in the background. Daily massages are heavenly, food well thought thru and prepared fresh. In between some sauna and cold pool. The schedule was even toght; I peaked to the beach but quickly came back to my concentration and meditative experience.  Travelling alone I was not expecting company but found awesome ladies on a similar mission. Owner Marcus is nice and present. Recommend the Sunday special ecstatic dance which drew a local crowd. Wonderful to dance away to a DJ middle of the day. Forget your reality and concentrate on you.
title: Yoga & detox retreat

photos.caption: Simple, clean, functional. Bathrobe, hair dryer included, daily water and tea kettle in room.
Yoga with a gentle sea breeze, perfect!
Udara Sunday event features ecstatic dance, led by a DJ it draws a local crowd. A day time dance party!
Even the normal yoga classes or wonderful. In addition to them, special events like this sound healing session with impressive surround sound system, takes your thoghts to another workd.

text:
What a wonderful and unique environment. Clean and professional. The whole team were amazing nothing was to much trouble. All the classes and facilities were great so much on offer. The spa team constantly cared for me with wonderful massages daily. 
The food was delicious and the service was efficient and friendly. Lisna smile and care was so nice and welcoming. Kadek Su made all the nutritional juices with so much care and always a smile.
My personal recommendation would be to have a 1 to 1 sound healing with Ady. I have had many sound healing but this was by far one of the best.
Thank you Udara I’ll be back
title: Just the most wonderful time

text: Spent 5 nights in June at this property.  Had an amazing time. The property itself is immaculate and the food was very good!  We very much enjoyed the yoga classes, the massages/treatments at the spa and the hot/cold pools. The staff were very polite and helpful throughout our stay. Tu Adi, Dede and Winu went over and above to make our stay enjoyable as well as Ayo in the restaurant. They were always smiling and eager to assist when needed. Would definitely recommend this beautiful hotel/yoga retreat when visiting Bali!
title: Beautiful hotel and yoga retreat!

text:
The Good: It has a very unique setout. And offers yoga, aerial yoga, and sound healing for their customers. At daytime you may stroll along the beach to Echo beach.
The Bad: Matrace was much too hard. At night you get the lights of the pool area in your bed, if your tiny bungalow is at the pool. I had lunch and dinner there. At night I got intense digestion problems and I had to throw up. I guess it was the fish. The main dishes are tasty, but the portions are so small that you should order a starter. I booked spontaneousley when I was in Canggu for 1 night with booking.com. Booking.com showed big room and a special offer. I ended up in a tiny bungalow at the pool.
title: Very mixed experience

text: I can’t express how wonderful this place is -  I came after a 24 hour flight and 15 time zones and although I only stayed 3.5 days I felt 1000% refreshed -  everyone was so friendly and the classes were perfect for my body -  massages by Mega were fantastic -  I’m coming back!!! Love what Marco has done.  Perfection
title: 1st time in Bali - but not my last

text: We stayed during covid, so the rooms were mostly vacants. Lightning on hotel area are reduced (maybe due to eficiency), a bit dark for our liking. No lift provided so if your room is not in ground floor be prepared to use the stairs. Not suitable for family with toddler or elderly. However, aside of that, if you are young, single or couple travelled to find some peace from busy life this is a great place. The hotel have direct access to quiet beach. There are sauna and steam room. Hot and cold pools. Yoga area.  The staffs were nice, especially Jumi who welcomed us when we arrived there. I suggested rent a vehicle (car or motorcycle) because the location a bit secluded and far from main road

First and foremost, the amazing hospitality and helpful mamager and staff. Staying at Udara Bali for 3 nights running a yoga retreat, this is very key

Then the shala, the sound healing cave and the outdoor massage with singing bowl before and after the session -  it is very very special. Must do for a trip to relax and heal.

Wooden walled AC bedroom with huge glass windows which i stayed in with access to a garden was a plus for a retrear stay. 

Now, the pescetarian wholesome food and smoothies are to die for! dont miss the stamped whole coconut for refreshinh yourself after yoga ot just to relax

Our highlight is the esctatic dance with cool DJ closed with sound healing journey! 

All of that for a great price!

One more thing: the beach is very accessible amd just sit on the shala to face the sunset with Kirtan by the manager is an unforgettable highlight of our trip

Am just so happy with this stay and definitely will return

text: Love everything about them. Udara is extremely an unique resort for me. It might be this is my first time experiencing stay at healing Resort. They are very close with Seseh beach and quite reachable to the small shop, restaurant or warung and etc. Nevertheless, they also have a restaurant which available for room dinning until 9pm. Foods had a great taste also many choices of the fresh and healty food. My room is extremely amazing, bed is sooo big and comfortable. I can see the sea view from my room which really pamper me a lot. The ambience definitely offer you a relaxatiton and peacefully. I really experienced different with Udara. They also offer and arrange some healty program like a Yoga classes, Detox and many more. If you just start like me, don't feel hesitate because they willing to guide us. Having said that, I so much enjoyed my time with Udara. My favorite one was the swimming pools. The design so unique. So many statue over there and there is one BIG turtle statue among the pools which really attracted me. I think this is the good spot to take the picture lol. Pools are consist of hot and cold water. Their staff explain to me, actually any special program which related with the concept of their pools. Then I believe, Udara completely the best healing resort in this area. Because they really care for every single thing to guide you to get an healty lifestyle. Despite, i didn't experience a lot in their program, i love them very much.

text:
My best experience ever! I was in Udara Bali in December 2019 and had a fantastic time there! I have done a 10-days Mind, Body and Soul recharge, which was my first retreat ever. And it was a perfect way to clear my mind before the New Year.

As it was a retreat programme, I came as a solo-traveler and fortunately, never found myself lonely! The staff was so friendly and supportive, that I even felt at home. Moreover, a separate table for the people on detox encouraged us to easily meet and make friends with those who were also doing a retreat here. This is how I met two amazing girls - from France and the USA.

The schedule included lots of activities that helped us to get out of a busy everyday routine and dive into self-reflection and self-development. My body was grateful for this. Each day started from a coconut, followed by various yoga classes, body treatments, and ceremonies. My favorite yoga was aerial yoga, it was an unforgettable experience of body stretching while overlooking the sunset over the ocean. Yin yoga was also amazing, nothing could be better before going to bed. Among body treatments, the real highlight was a water-healing session with Martina. It was something mind-blowing that I certainly recommend! It was my first time, and I will never forget this feeling of relaxation and protection as if I were in a baby cradle. The programme also included trips to the healer, water temple and ceremonies. You will be really lucky if your programme takes place during the new moon, the time of the Kirtan&Cacao ceremony in Udara. You'd better experience it yourself rather than just read about it. 35 people in one room, singing songs and sharing their plans for the future. Such a strong feeling of unity!

The hotel provides amazing facilities: two swimming pools, a steam room, sauna, jacuzzi, and a spa center. The rooms are big (beds are huge and super comfortable) and have a marvelous view. Every single detail in this hotel is thoughtful: from yoga space, where you can overlook the ocean, to the amazing stairs with snakes and monkeys. I could not stop taking photos. My favorite thing though was a night relaxation in a warm swimming pool, enjoying underwater music and gazing at the stars.

Udara Bali is located right in front of the ocean, which is quite rare for hotels in this area. The sea is amazing! However, it’s not overcrowded at all. It is a kind of a secret beach which on the one side is close to Canggu (just 20 min walk from La Brisa), but, at the same time, it is not full of tourists.

The staff was always very kind, and I felt as if I were in a family, Udara Family. Another thing which surprised me was that here, in Udara, they really took care of the society and even organized free Yoga classes and an ecstatic dance on Sundays. Giving back to the community is a very kind gesture.

It has been one month since I came back home, but I still have a feeling of gratitude to this amazing place in my heart. So, if you are thinking of going for a retreat (or just staying for a couple of nights) in Udara, I strongly recommend this amazing place. Udara is a true gem!

If you have any questions about the retreat, feel free to contact me.

Many thanks and lots of love to Udara Bali,

Kristina

 

P.S. Warm greetings to Adi, Martina, Violetta, Marcus and my favorite bartenders.
title: My best experience ever!

text: Where do I start - PERFECT ! Desperate for a mental unwind and reset I came across Udara after googling - well being retreat . It was the budget and beach location that sold me and I couldn’t be happier with my choice. Value for money is an understatement. The beach location provided the constant sound of waves , the facilities are totally focussed on mindfulness and calming the mind and body. Hot and cold pools with underwater meditation music , sauna, steam room , spa , yoga and meditation spaces overlooking the beach and yoga / meditation programs to suit everybody. It was my first yoga experience ( aged 52) and the teachers were kind, supportive , positive and made me feel very comfortable. Udara is located away from tourist areas so is very peaceful but not too far away if you want to walk or shuttle up to the hustle and bustle. The pathways are created as mindful walking areas so you will be walking around beautiful but uneven grounds at times (maybe wary for people with weak ankles). The rooms and all facilities are clean and tastefully traditional Balinese. The meals are lovingly prepared and delicious and the staff are incredible . I cannot praise Udara enough . Daily massage was included in my package and meals and the whole experience was PERFECT.
title: Perfect place for a mental unwind and reset

text:
Wow! Where to begin? 
I stayed at Udara on my own to do a 12 day juice detox program. I was looking for a reset of mind and body. I diffidently came to the right place!

Udara is like a warm bath, like coming home. 

I was guided through my journey by wellness coaches Martina and Violette. They really made me feel I was not alone on my journey and were there every step of the way with advice. 

The staff behind the front desk and in the restaurant could not have been more friendly. Within no time everyone knew my name and greeted me with a huge smile.

The spa treatments ( I was pampered with 1 massage a day:), where really worth the while. I requested the same staff for my whole stay ( only because the massage was perfect on my first day), and this was no problem at all. At Udara they are always happy to accommodate.

I had the chance to try lots of different Yoga programs which was great for me as beginner. Areal Yoga was definitely my favorite. Now back to “ real” life for a few days I’m already missing it!

The warm pool and sauna were so relaxing. Sauna is open all day from 8am to 10pm. As part of my detox program I was encouraged to go in the sauna every day. I had no experience, but started looking forward to my sauna moments very quickly. 

I can not review the food as I was on juices every day. But from what I saw it is amazing! 

I came alone, but did not stay alone. Udara is a place where people mingle( if you do not want this, it is no problem to stay on your own). I met wonderful friends! Like minded people. 

Last but not least. The owner Marcus lives close by and is every much involved with his retreat and this you can feel when you are there. Lots of care goes into everything and staff is happy. 

Gustie! Thank you for booking me in! The whole booking process was easy and informative. It was a great introduction to Udara.

Thank you to the whole team! I will definitely be back soon!
title: Amazing experience

text:
This was my first detox retreat and I am so glad I did it at Udara.

From the moment I initially arrived until I was leaving the have been fantastic. Everyone is smiling, friendly and nothing is ever too much. Marcus, the owner, has created such a beautiful space, the pictures don't do it justice. The spa and the yoga area is incredible.

As for the detox, the juices and soups were plenty alongside the supplements they provided. Additionally the enemas and colonic irrigation made me feel like a brand new person inside after 7 days. I could finally see my abs again after like 1 year! haha 

I came to Udara never having done much yoga but with the intention to try the different yoga classes, hoping that I would start enjoying yoga. I am pleased to say that I really enjoyed the yoga in particular the aerial yoga and yin yoga. Just by doing 7 days of yoga, I increased my flexibility and noticed a range in my movements, thanks to the amazing teachers.

I also want to thank Violetta and Martina who are so full of knowledge and positivity. You both have made my first detox easier. Also shout out to Win who turned out to be an amazing photographer!

Shame I couldn't eat the beautiful food as I was on a liquid diet however I will be back to try it all!

Thank you again to Marcus and all the wonderful staff for a life changing experience :)
title: 7 Day Detox

text: As a neophyte to Yoga retreats, Udara was a great introduction for a 6 day intensive immersion in Yoga & meditation. I learnt a lot & had a wonderful time & felt healthier when I left. The facilities were very comprehensive & it is in a very peaceful area north of Canggu, Bali with paddy fields behind & the waves on the beach in front.  In contrast to other more tourist orientated areas, this is peaceful oasis. The Balinese people are calm & the staff at Udara were very obliging & friendly. Udara is only 18 mths old & purpose built as a yoga retreat, it sits just behind the beach with the local community fishing boats pulled up out front. The 4 Yoga shalas all have great views over the beach.The local villagers gather on the beachfront in the evenings, as well as worship at the temple next door. Its about a 1 hr drive from the airport at Denpasar & I used the transfer service suggested by Udara staff- its community run from the village & the cars are very modern SUVs. Its great to see that Udara very much supports the community surrounding it with links like this as well as many of the staff living either in this village or not far away. Likewise it was great to have many of the yoga instructors being Balinese- I particularly found GusWira to be inspiring & he made me feel happy & relaxed. There is a huge range of classes- I ended up spending 4-6 hrs every day in various classes- ie all types of Yoga & meditation, aerial yoga , water yoga, water aerobics. Martina & Violetta are great teachers- I especially liked the Candle light yin session last Tuesday night led by Martina. I had a Balinese massage every day on the rooftop spa area- so relaxing. The rooms are well appointed though the beds are quite hard ( maybe my particular taste here) If you can, request one of the rooms upstairs as the rooms downstairs are quite dark ( again personal preference here for a light room ) The food was also very good- fresh, healthy with a wide range for choice. Quite a few people come to eat here from outside the hotel. Aside from some gentle music on Friday nights, this is not a party place. Would love the return for another recharge of my body, Namaste.
title: Rejuvenation at Udara

text: we recently hosted a group of about a dozen students for a week-long yoga retreat at Udara, and it was simply amazing. Udara is located in a small village called Seseh, which is filled with gorgeous temples, and has a quiet, laid-back vibe (even by Bali standards) with super friendly local residents. the resort is like something out of a fairy tale, with several pools and steam rooms of varying temperatures, all randomly spread out and designed to look and feel as if you discovered them deep in the jungle somewhere. the yoga facilities include a beautiful and spacious shala with nice wood floors, perfect for large to medium-size groups, in addition to gorgeous aerial yoga deck and rooftop meditation areas. what I loved most about Udara though was the fact that the staff really treated us like family, and that in addition to our own events, there were all kinds of classes our students could attend for free throughout the day. the food was sublime -- healthy, organic, creative and delicious! truly some of the best meals I've ever had in Bali. rooms were spacious and comfortable, and the owner Markus was always around making sure that we were well cared-for. Udara is also a short drive to places like Echo Beach and Tanah Lot temple, which are perfect daytrips. and the staff were super helpful in helping us arrange all kinds of things, from babysitters to drivers to Balinese dance teachers. I'll never forget this wonderful place, and we will definitely be coming back again. a few things to be aware of, the pool area can be a bit dangerous since you have to climb over rocks, etc. so be careful especially with children. also, like many areas of Bali that are in less developed areas, there's not much nearby in terms of shops or restaurants other than Udara's own restaurant, and the power/internet can randomly go out sometimes. but that's typical of places like this in Bali. in the end, any inconveniences were far outweighed by Udara's beauty and unique charm.
title: spectacular place to host a yoga retreat!

The place is a reflection of the creative brain of the owner, Marcus, who is often present and very accessible for a talk or diner together. You really can feel this place has a soul and everything that is created here breaths delicatesse, love and style. Thanks you Markus for this stay, thank you staff for your efforts, I already booked for April and October, because there is one little downside to this place, even 1 year after the opening it is very popular and you have to book in advance!

text:
I arrived at Denpasar airport and was a little nervous as id never been to Bali.. I was greeted by a smiling gentleman holding a sign with my name on it and instantly i felt comfortable..(i apologise i can't even try to pronounce or spell your name!)  During the drive to Udara Bali he was so very friendly and answered all my questions and pointed out certain statues and their meaning to me.. 

When i arrived at Udara Bali i was instantly calm, all my bags were carried for me and i felt like i had come home. Never being here before it was a strange feeling but i went with it. I was so overwhelmed with the friendly staff and the outer worldly visions of design every where i looked. The detail at Udara Bali is just amazing! Everywhere you look there is an incredible sculpture, carving or just inspired imagery. 

Upon getting into my room i was greeted by Violetta, one of my wellness coaches. Violetta has a warmth to her personality that makes you feel at home, a sense of friendship with the first hello. We did my weigh in and measurements which i was a little confronted by at first mention of it but Violetta made me feel totally comfortable with the situation. 
I was given my schedule and a welcome drink and booklet with all the details of my 14 day stay and what my detox would involve.. I was very impressed with the thorough detail and attention to hearing my concerns and curiosity and i felt comfortable and like this had been the right decision to make for myself.
I then had some time to unpack and i then met Martina, my other Wellness coach who was another source of friendship and support and knowledge. Martina became someone i will cherish knowing and am so very thankful to have met. Martina puts her whole heart and soul into helping others find that inner peace we are all looking for and i observed her doing this daily to everyone she was in contact with! Martina's dedication to making a difference in others lives is just so humbling. 

Over the next week i barely noticed i wasn't eating solid food, i wasn't hungry not even once! All the supplements and the juices and my morning coconut and the schedule keeps you as busy and distracted or as relaxed to focus as you desire. 

I met so many other wonderful people during my stay that I've created life long friendships with people who are on the same vibration as myself and that was just so lovely in itself. 

Udara Bali has a calm and peace about it. The staff aren't like your average staff, within the first couple of days i felt like i was surrounded by friends and by the end of my stay i felt like id made a new family whom i will have to return to visit again. 

The detox for me was life changing. I had recently had my heart broken and i wasn't happy and by the end of the first week i felt an overwhelming sense of love for myself and my surroundings and everyone i was crossing paths with on my journey.

Udara Bali is honestly something magical... there were times i just sat in stillness and meditated with my eyes open in awe of the energy i was consuming with every breath.. my stay was so very healing for my body heart and soul and was exactly what i needed, even more than id expected and everything i couldve wanted.. 

Markus the owner is like no other owner i have every met during my travels. He is humble and personable and also someone i would consider a friend i hope to see when i return. 
The events i went to.. just wow... 
The Watsu Sauna Sound healing - if i had gone to bali and just attended that one night and left again i would've been happy.. I smiled non stop for days after that night and even woke a few times during the following nights giggling like a little girl not even mad it was 3 am and i had woken to laugh before peacefully falling back to sleep. 

The Kirtan Cacao Ceremony was so very special.. the effort and love that went into that event made everyone feel like a goddess..after it concluded i literally floated back to my room and felt like my heart could potentially burst it was so full of love and gratitude for where i was, who i was and how this amazing place and people were who i realised were helping me, help myself to heal my heart. 

On the last day i did my final weigh in ( first and last day only do you do weigh in to check how you went)... i was shocked.. i lost 6% overall body fat and 11kg!! I felt like a different person and when i look at photos from when i arrived to when i left i looked like a different person too.. 

Even if your not doing a detox or yoga retreat and you simply stay at Udara it is still a magical experience.. I met others who went for a holiday and left feeling renewed and a deep sense of love for themselves.. 

I can't thank everyone at Udara enough for how my 14 days with them all changed me for the better. I have returned home and am now continuing on another 14 days of detox fasting.. My stay at Udara has motivated me to love myself more and do better for myself.. I got more out of my detox journey at Udara than i couldve imagined was actually possible in such a short period of time. 

I truly feel like i was Alice in wonderland and i went down a rabbit hole to a magical place that changed my perspective and filled my heart with love and I'm so so happy and grateful i chose this wonderful place. 

I will be back soon to give everyone big hugs and this time try all the incredible food i was watching and smelling everyone eating and not to mention hearing from everyone how delicious it was!! 

Thank you from my heart body and soul to everyone at Udara Bali for being a part of my transformation into a better version of myself! I will never forget you all and i will be seeing you all again soon!
title: 14 Day Detox Retreat - Life Changing experience with incredible results! Reasonably priced too!

text: Room was excellent, very clean, bed huge. Good shower. The facilities were amazing. Two areas for yoga with sea views, free classes because you stay there. Free shuttle to the town, although didn't use it. The pools were stunning, one temperate warm, one warm with music playing underwater. Cold water dipping pool and a warm Jacuzzi. Steam room and sauna. The design of it is stunning, carved and sculptured like under a tree, with animals (sauna was inside a turtle for example). Food was great, it was all seafood or vegetarian so I was a bit concerned being a big meat eater but it was lovely. The juices you can get are amazing too. I had a big concern with Bali as I have a delicate stomach but eating in this hotel I felt better than I do at home! The staff were amazing as were the people of Bali, so friendly. The area is very safe too, in the countryside next to the beach, which is a stone throw away. A surfers beach though, didn't  look suitable for swimming.

text:
I have read the reviews of others & there is no doubt that if you are a yoga regular then this will appeal. Both of us however are Pilates regulars ,but that does not necessarily translate to yoga. The design is quirky yet functional.
Generally the impression is the place is designed more with yoga sessions in mind rather than a resort.On the 2nd & 3rd floors which have great ocean views ,are the yogas classes. The ground/1st floor is the Dinning room which doesn’t have an ocean view as it is blocked by a shed for fishing boats . If the place was really resort oriented then the Dinning room would be upstairs with the view & breeze.
2 pools ,warm & cool ,not large ,but didn’t appear to be well used.
There is a small grassed area at front with bean bags for sun baking ,
Food varies, breakfast only average, fruit ,scrambled eggs, tomato & noodles Lunch & dinner menu is restricted by being fish or vegetarian. Scallops salad was the highlight.seafood pasta good as was vegitable curry .
Wifi didn’t work in bedroom .We had garden room ground floor which had a small bedroom for price & outdoor area didn’t get the breeze so we didn’t use it .
Staff great. VW Kombi leaves to Echo Beach Canggu from 2 ,4, 6 & 10pm with return on 1/2 hr. We took 6pm takes at least 20 min. Taxi return 100,000 to 150,000R .
Walk to Echo Beach ,La Brisa 20 min on beach low tide & pleasant longer at high tide & not as pleasant.
There is no surf in front of resort , nearest break of any merit is past elephant temple about 2 km or 15 min. 
We mainly ate out at Echo beach. Gi restaurant upstairs VG, Mason for woodfired lamb shoulder ,chicken fish VG. La Brisa great save for terrible & load music ,Echo Beach Bar also ok with great view & cheap.Lawn beach club better music ,but average food.
We stayed 7 days which in hindsight was too long - 3 to 4 would be plenty.
All in all if you are looking for peace & quite & yoga it would suit , if looking for place close to surf & restaurants then look elsewhere.
title: Great if you are into yoga

text:
I really enjoyed my stay here. 

The yoga classes are expertly led and small enough for individual attention. There is a huge variety and if you want, you can do yoga day and night. There are a  large variety of skill levels in the people who stay there. My partner enjoyed it and he had only done yoga once. 

The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and large.

The dinner/lunch is delicious and vegetarian but be aware, it's not the cheapest meal. 

You can hire a scooter if you need which I'd recommend as there's not much super close by, but a lot only a short scooter ride away. 

I'd not recommend bringing your kids here unless they're quiet. We had our night time yin yoga sessions interrupted by screaming children in the pool. They were asked several times to be quiet but kids are kids. Pools are fun!

The pool area is actually just so impressive! You have to see it to believe it!

I had my nails done and the lady was lovely but confused and pushy when I didn't tip. I had assumed it was an inclusive price because it was so expensive. It's a bit awkward being from a country that doesn't tip and never knowing when this is appropriate. I think I'd just get a salon treatment in town next time. She also gave a massage that was very good but I was on the roof and it didn't feel very private as I was stripping off clothes where anyone could walk in.

text:
I was not sure what to expect having never been to Canggu or Seseh Beach before. Our taxi even got a little lost on the way. But it was well worth the ride to get here. It took me most of our first afternoon to explore the many levels, nooks and crannies that make up this surprising and delightful hotel. The original design is a visual treat. Where to start in listing all the qualities? 
Yoga - awesome variety and great instructors, held in a stunning setting. From memory there are at least six sessions a day but check the website for more detail. The focus is on doing the best you can do as an individual - no ego, so totally fine for beginners through to advanced people.
Rooms - beautifully designed, clean white sheets and towels, comfy beds, amazing private outdoor bathrooms, aircon, funky door locking system, beautiful dark wooden walls. Solar power.
Staff - super friendly and helpful.
Food - an awesome breakfast  on both the included and 'a la carte' menu. Healthy natural foods. The smoothies and juices are fresh and carefully constructed. I love the attention to being eco friendly with bamboo straws.
The restaurant onsite has an amazing menu of reasonably priced and healthy foods. Great for people who are gluten free or have food allergies too. It was so good we chose to eat here every night!
Location - A quiet spot facing the ocean, so good to get away from the traffic and rush you can find in other parts of Bali. But.. if you do want a bit of action it is a short walk along the beach to Echo Beach where there are bars, shops, spas etc. The hotel also provides a free shuttle into Canggu about 4 times daily in a cute little combi van.
A taxi trip to the airport is around $30 NZ dollars
The Beach - right outside the door. A bit rough at times but people surf here and there are surf lessons for beginners too. The water is clean, so nice to see people fishing early in the morning.
Facilities - an amazingly designed finnish sauna, plunge pool, cold pool with swim up bar and a warm pool for water yoga. There is even a meditation cave. A little lawn area with bean bags and umbrellas to chill out and read or sunbathe. The restaurant area is also a great place to read, sit, play a board game and relax.
Check out the photos on the Udara website - they give a true reflection of this wonderful little gem.

I would watch small children here as there are pools and heights. 
The only negative I have is the massage we booked here. The masseuses were 15 minutes late and all three of us had very average massages. The price was fairly high (about $30 NZ each for an hour). I would head into Echo Beach and go to a spa there. We tried Yoga Balispa and had good massages for $18 (90 minutes). A taxi from Udara to Echo Beach costs about 100.000 rupiah (about 10 NZ dollars) or just walk along the beach!!

text: Travelling for nearly three weeks through  Bali ,  we had booked Udara Yoga Resort for the last days before departure back home. The site is quite close to airport. The desgin of the entire property/architecture is just exceptional and unique;   completly new in  modern natural style, only  a few steps away from the beach (no swimming there). The interior decoration in the room is made of pure untreated wood which gives awonderful scent and cosy feeling.  We loved the breakfast with  amazing healthy choices.  Also we had  lovely dinners, healthy  and absolutely delicous ( vegetarian/vegan ) and great sea food (fishermen nearby...).  All meals are cooked on site by the staff. The greenery in the courtyard, and scenic pool area inside  is lovely. Staff are very courteous and helpful. They are really warm and friendly people; lovely atmosphere in the hotel. I loved the view of the yoga  studio on the open roof top, overlooking the  ocean. Also I enjoyed the sound of the sea when doing candle light Yin in the evening.  Excellent yoga instructors and a great schedule of different yoga classes where one can join impulsively. For hotel guests all yoga hours (approx. 9 hours a day at 7 days!) are included! At the end of our holiday on Bali,  it was just the perfect stay for relaxation.  We enjoyed the place of location surrounded by "real" Bali (local people & Balinese life, as we felt "not  touristic").  You can even walk to Tannah Loth along the beach (approx.4 km) early in the morning 😊 . The other direction is Canggu which has got many restaurants there... + popular beach for surfer (but not crowded!).
title: 19.-22.8. wonderful and relaxing stay

text:
The place is in front of the beach, and if you walk towards the right looking at the ocean, there are actually more quite places away from the fishermen where you can sunbath and swim (big waves though).
The architecture is amazing, they have a pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna, etc. And the yoga classes. All this is complimentary with the price of the room so very worth it if you take place in those activities.
We had the room on the 3rd floor with a stunning view on the ocean, amazing! Very clean room with AC, with small outdoor bathroom (maybe not for too modest people/privacy :/). But great for 2 people especially when you spend most of your day outside.
You can rent scooters there which is great to get to Canggu or explore the area (beautiful sea temple nearby).
The staff is very friendly and helpful.

If you're not taking place in yoga classes or enjoying the SPA, then you might want to look for another place. The price is quite high for just sleeping and go to the beach. It is in the middle of nowhere, which can although be nice for those who don't like touristy hypster canggu.

The food was delicious and served with lots of smiles. We will definitely be back to Udara...thank you for a lovely stay!

text: Arrived to the Udara today and left within a few hours. I booked the Udara because it described itself as a beachfront resort and spa. I even upgraded my room to a full beach view. Where do begin with the problems of what it claims to be and what it actually is? Let's start with "beach." In front of the hotel are buildings used by the local fishermen which block the view and the direct access.  When asked about the beach, the staff informed me that I would have to walk a kilometer down the beach to get to the swimming area. I then went to the room. To see the ocean view, you had to walk through the outdoor bathroom and out the back door. Then, you had to turn your head 90 degrees. It took a lot of work to see the view. Let's discuss the word resort. This was at best a nice little hotel with resort pricing on the extras (spa, food, etc). There was one desk where you checked in, had the jacuzzi turned on, booked your appointments, etc. The sitting area around the pool held about 7 chairs,that's it. This was NOT a resort. Let's talk about the rooms -- small, air conditioning that was barely working, broken tiles, drawers you could've open due to furniture being too close together. It was also in the middle of nowhere. It took 20 minutes for a cab to show up when leaving the hotel.  Positives: They had a great yoga area with classes four times a day and the staff was very helpful and allowed me to cancel without penalty.
title: Not a Resort

text:
Shortly summaries: welcome to heavens paradise.
 
Absolute amazing place.
 
The location itself is extraordinary. More to the north of Legian and Echo beach (only  15 Min. walk at the black sandy beach to Echo beach) you will find Pantai Seseh, on the way to Tanah Lot.
 
The accommodation has individual styled rooms from 3 bungalows,
to different rooms with different view, size etc.
In detail you will find wooden carved hand-made ceilings etc.
 
The bathroom is in Balinese style open.
Due that the hotel is brand new everything is excellent.
Room cleaning was for us 5 star.
 
There are 4 Yoga Shalas -  2 very large Yoga places one in the first floor and one at the 2nd.
From the second you have an amazing 270° over view from the ocean still to 80km away volcano Mount Agung (if the weather is good).
 
On the ground floor you have a big terrace for breakfast, lunch and dinner which is sheltered and very nice.
The food there is excellent.
 
You will find there in the middle of the hotel under the 1st stage Yoga area the pools.
and Sauna, a steaming Bath and a relaxing room.
 
At this place you can enter to Bali in many ways.
Combine sightseeing, walking at the beach, excellent food, professional Yoga teaching almost over the ocean,
And feel like in heaven.
 
Have a look to my photos, which I took after Christmas at my first, but not last stay, at Udara Beach Resort Yoga & Spa.
 
Thanxx a lot to the friendly staff there.

Highly recommended.
title: Welcome to heavens paradise

text:
Wir haben als Pärchen das Retreat-Paket für 18 Nächte gewählt und hatten vom ersten Tag an das bekommen, was wir uns so sehr erhofft haben - einen "echten Urlaub" zu machen, bei dem wir uns vom gewohnten Alltag verabschieden und viel Zeit für uns, unseren Körper und unsere Seele nehmen können. Das ganze Hotelpersonal war dabei auf so einer ehrlichen Art freundlich und zuvorkommend, dass wir uns wie zu Hause fühlen konnten und uns ganz auf uns konzentrieren konnten.

In unserem Retreat-Paket enthalten, waren gesunde und stets frisch zubereitete Mahlzeiten und Getränke zum Frühstück, Mittag, Afternoon-Snack und Dinner. Unser Zimmer war angenehm eingerichtet und mit zwei Doppelbetten äußerst groß, was wahrscheinlich auch mit unserem langen Aufenthalt und dem Retreat-Paket zusammenhing. Die Aussicht von unserer grünen Terasse aus war fabelhaft und morgens im Bad das Meeresrauschen zu hören, war ein täglicher Genuss.

Besonders hervorzuheben sind die vielzähligen und sehr abwechslungsreichen Yoga-Kurse, welche durch sehr professionelle aber vor allem sehr herzliche und fürsorgliche Trainer begleitet wurden. Das Udara Bali wurde für uns, nicht zuletzt aufgrund seiner architektonischen Gestaltung, zu einem wahren Yoga Tempel, der sehr dazu geeignet ist, auch als Neuling den richtigen Zugang zu Yoga zu finden und diesen in seinem zukünftigen Alltag fest zu verankern. Im Paket enthalten waren zudem auch noch tägliche und frei auswählbare Massagen von Kopf bis Fuß sowie der Zugang zum Spa-Bereich mit Sauna, Whirlpool und Eisbad. Allein mit dem Angebot war unser Tag schon gut ausgefüllt.

Von Architektur und Einrichtung über Gastfreundlichkeit und Ernährung bis hin zum täglichen Programmangebot an Yoga, Massage und Special Events wurde uns hier vom ersten Tag an ein stimmiges und ehrlich gelebtes Gesamtkonzept geboten, welches sich nicht nur Retreat-Paket nennen darf, sondern bei uns auch zur vollsten Zufriedenheit und Entspannung gesorgt hat. Wir können das Udara Bali nur jedem empfehlen, der etwas änhliches sucht wie wir. Ganz nebenbei lohnt sich auch eine odere mehrere Sitzungen in der Hyperbaric Oxygen Chamber zum Relaxen und Regenerieren.
title: Wahres Retreat im Udara Bali

text:

Ho soggiornato per due settimane in questo resort e mi è sembrato di vivere in un sogno!!!

La cucina è eccezionale,ogni piatto oltre ad essere buonissimo è presentato con cura per ogni particolare.I ragazzi dello staff sono dolcissimi,molto amichevoli e disponibili per ogni necessità.
Complimenti anche al titolare Markus per questa gestione perfetta.
È stata la mia vacanza migliore in assoluto fino ad ora.
Non riesco a trovare niente di negativo.
Provare per credere!!😊🙏🤍

text:
Die gesamte Anlage, die Zimmer und auch das Spa ist wunderschön, einzigartig und sauber! 😍 
Das Personal & der Eigentümer sind super freundlich & zuvorkommend! Man merkt auch, dass ein sehr gutes Klima innerhalb vom Personal des Udara Bali herrscht und alle gut behandelt werden. 
Das Essen ist wirklich ausgezeichnet, gesund & frisch! 
Die Yoga-Stunden sind für jeden geeignet (egal, ob Anfänger oder Profi). Das Programm ist sehr abwechslungsreich, die Atmosphäre ist unglaublich schön und es kommen sogar sehr viele Leute von außerhalb, um bei den Yoga-Stunden teilzunehmen, da diese so gut sind! 
Es gibt übrigens auch viele Special-Events wie z.B. Ecstatic Dance, Relaxing Sound Healing, die ich nur empfehlen kann! 

Ich hatte das RawFood-Detox-Programm für 9 Tage gebucht und es ist beinhaltet einfach alles 😍! 
Volle Verpflegung (Essen & Trinken), alle Yoga-Stunden & Special-Events, Ausflüge zu verschiedenen Sehenswürdigkeiten (z.B. Ceremony in einem Water Temple, Monkey Forest etc.) und vielen anderen Aktivitäten. 
Danke für die tolle Zeit bei euch! Ich komme auf jeden Fall wieder!
title: Absolut zu empfehlen! Es hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen!

text:
Wir waren zum ersten Mal im Udara Bali und sind begeistert. 

Lage: Hängt sicher davon ab was man sucht, für uns aber einfach top. Direkt am Meer mit tollem Ausblick, entspannte Spaziergänge im glitzernden Sand, Wellenreiten direkt vor dem Hotel und mit dem Scooter oder zu Fuß in wenigen Minuten in Changgu (mit einer riesigen Auswahl an Bars / Restaurants). Highlight war auch der Strandspaziergang direkt vom Resort zu Tanah Lot - einfach traumhaft. Für uns DIE top Lage in Bali.

Ausstattung: Mit enorm viel Liebe zum Detail wurden die Zimmer und der SPA Bereich gestaltet. Die Yoga-Stunden finden mit sensationellem Blick aufs Meer statt, Massagen auf dem Rooftop mit super Blick und Meeresrauschen.

Personal: Wir waren mehrere Wochen in Asien unterwegs. Die Menschen sind in Indonesien grundsätzlich sehr freundlich - so trifft man auch im Udara auf unglaublich hilfsbereites, aufmerksames und sympathisches Personal die eine wunderschöne Atmosphäre schaffen.

Jeden Tag werden nicht nur zahlreiche Yoga-Stunden angeboten sondern auch Sound Healing oder Meditation - sehr vielfältig und auch dank der guten Trainer eine wunderbare Erfahrung.

Auch der SPA Bereich ist super - muss man gesehen haben sonst glaubt man es nicht wie kunstvoll dieser gestaltet wurde.

Udara Bali ist ein magischer Ort zum Entspannen und Urlaub machen - wir kommen wieder!
title: Ein magischer Ort in Bali

text:
Wir haben im November einige Tage im Udara Bali verbracht. Unsere Zeit auf Bali war traumhaft schön. Trotz später Anreise wurden wir mit einer frischen Kokosnuss im Hotel herzlich willkommen geheißen. Der Service im Hotel war exzellent, das gesamte Personal war zu jeder Zeit freundlich, hilfsbereit und sehr liebenswert. Während unserem Aufenthalt wurden wir von dem Personal immer mit Vornamen begrüßt, was eine einzigartige Atmosphäre zaubert.

Obwohl wir nicht zur eigentlichen Zielgruppe gehören, haben wir einige der Yoga-Kurse besucht. Alle Trainer haben die Übungen sehr gut erklärt und waren hilfsbereit, sodass man auch als „Yoga-Neuling“ problemlos teilnehmen kann. Besonders das Aerial Yoga hat uns begeistert. Der Ausblick, das Gefühl und die Stimmung während dem Kurs sind fantastisch.

Auch die besondere Gestaltung des Hotels und des Spa-Bereichs machen den Aufenthalt zu einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis. Die Sauna im Bauch der Rießen-Schildkröte aus Stein als auch die verschiedenen Becken und Pools sorgen für absolute Entspannung. Das Highlight in unserem Verwöhn Programm war die Massage. Diese haben wir in der obersten Etage im Freien bei Meeres rauschen und leichter Brise genossen.

Egal ob an der Pool-Bar oder im Restaurant, die Speisen und Getränke werden immer frisch zubereitet und sind sehr lecker. Das Angebot umfasst zahlreiche Gerichte mit Obst, Gemüse und Fisch und wird auch optisch immer sehr ansprechend angerichtet.

Wir haben einige Ausflüge auf Bali unternommen. Egal ob Rafting-Tour, Monkey Forest, Ubud City, Bedugul, Tana Lot, Jatiluwih, Schnorcheltrip, …. das Rezeptionspersonal hat uns hierbei immer super unterstützt und beraten.
Aufgrund der tollen Lage des Hotels direkt am Strand von Seseh lädt der Strand zu Spaziergängen ein. Der dunkle Sand glitzert in der Sonne und sorgt für eine traumhaft schöne Atmosphäre. Auch kann man über den Strand Canggu problemlos zu Fuß erreichen. Hier gibt es zahlreiche gute Restaurants, Bars und tolle Shops. Wenn man möchte, bringt der Hotel-Shuttle einen dann auch wieder zurück.

Unser Zimmer  war sehr groß und hatte eine Klimaanlage und einen Ventilator. Es wurde täglich gereinigt und war sehr sauber. Das Zimmer verfügte über ein Badezimmer mit Dusche und WC. Über unser Zimmer konnten wir eine Terrasse hinter halb des Gebäudes erreichen, wo man den Sonnenaufgang genießen konnte.

Vielen Dank für den sensationellen Urlaub! 
Sabrina + Tanja
title: Einzigartige Atmosphäre im Udara Bali - ein unvergesslich schöner Urlaub!

text:
Wir verbrachten 5 Tage im Udara Bali inkl. 3tägigem Detox-Programm. 
Vom ersten Moment an wurden wir herzlich willkommen geheissen und das gesamte Personal war stets freundlich, zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit. 
Das Detox-Programm wurde durch zwei professionelle Mitarbeiterinnen, Martina & Violetta, begleitet. Wir waren stets beschäftigt mit Yoga, Wasser-Aerobic, Massage, Dampfbad/Sauna, Schlafen und natürlich unseren Detox-Drinks & Shots. Selten haben wir an das Essen gedacht und erst gegen Abend haben wir uns auf die leckere Kürbissuppe gefreut. 
Generell war das Angebot an Getränken und Mahlzeiten (Healthy Food) im Hotelrestaurant sensationell.
Ein kleiner Wehmutstropfen ist das Gebäude vor dem Resort, welches die Sicht auf den Strand versperrt.
Danke an alle für die erholsamen und schönen Tag bei euch! Isabelle
title: Erholung & gutes Tun für die Gesundheit

text:
En primer lugar, la gente que atiende cada uno de los servicios es realmente atenta, cálida y están al pendiente de tus necesidades permanentemente.
La habitación es sumamente confortable y me encantan los baños al exterior.
La dinámica para llegar a los servicios en la planta baja ( sauna, piletas, jacuzzi, etc, es algo complicado por la sofisticación de su diseño, mientras que los servicios de las plantas altas, son salones abiertos para las clases de yoga, meditación y masajes que cuentan con maravillosas vistas al mar.
Hay muchas clases de diferentes tipos de yoga y podes elegir actividad o descansar en la playa en la pileta.
Tiene un shuttle que te lleva y te trae de Canggu.
Yo fui primero por 5 noches, luego me fui a otro lugar y me volví por 4 noches más. Extrañaba tener todo a mano, con actividades organizadas y la libertad de elegir.
Lo super recomiendo!
title: Un lugar increíble!

text: Wir haben als Familie einige Tage im Udara Beach Resort verbracht und waren begeistert. Und dies obwohl wir gar nicht zur eigentlichen Zielgruppe des Ressorts gehören, den Yoga-Fans. Es werden wirklich viele Kurse angeboten, die wir aber gar nicht genutzt haben. Nur beim Wasseryoga haben wir mal reingeschnuppert und es hat Spaß gemacht. Wären wir noch länger geblieben, hätten wir mit Sicherheit noch mehr Kurse besucht. Anfänger sind jedenfalls grundsätzlich herzlich willkommen.Doch auch für uns Nichtyogis hatte das Resort die perfekte Lage, um von hier aus Ausflüge ins Land zu unternehmen. Die Unterkunft liegt im noch ursprünglichen kleinen Ort Seseh. Wer mehr Trubel will, kann mit den top gepflegten Motorrollern oder Fahrrädern, die das Hotel zur Verfügung stellt, auf Tour in die nähere Umgebung gehen. Wer weiter weg will, für den organisiert das Hotel die Ausflüge. Uns ist ein leerer Strand ohne Trubel zudem sowieso lieber. Daher war auch diesbezüglich die Lage perfekt. Wer’s aber gerne lebhafter will, kann einfach am Strand entlang spazieren, um schnell zum gerade top angesagten Echo-Beach mit seiner Surfszene zu gelangen. Essen im Udara ist superlecker; die Zimmer sind individuell mit viel Liebe zum Detail eingerichtet. Die Mitarbeiter motiviert und herzlich. Wir alle vier (von 15 bis 50) waren jedenfalls begeistert und werden wiederkommen.
title: Perfekt

text: Nous avons passé les deux dernières nuits de notre voyage à Bali dans cet hôtel formidable. Les chambres (nous avions une suite pour 3 personnes), sont très spacieuses et magnifiquement décorées. Les photos sont loin de refléter la vraie beauté du lieu. Les matériaux utilisés(bois, pierre, literie...) sont haut de gamme. La propreté est parfaite. La salle de bain surprenante et le jardin avec vue mer est au top. Le petit déjeuner buffet est excellent. L'ambiance zen du lieu est très agréable et les équipements (piscines, hammam, sauna...) donnent envie de ne plus bouger. L'océan est agité (mais possibilité de se baigner devant l'hôtel sous surveillance des MNS), mais magnifique pour ceux qui aiment la calme et l'absence de foule. Le restaurant propose une cuisine raffinée et inattendue. Les cocktails de fruits sans alcool sont à tomber. Le personnel est très souriant et toujours ravi d'échanger quelques mots (excepté les gens de l'accueil paradoxalement!). Nous aurions aimé y passer quelques nuits de plus. Le seul bémol est l'accès aux autres restaurants qui doit se faire en taxi ou scooter. Nous avons choisi l'accès à pied par la plage, mais il faut être prêt à se mouiller jusqu'aux mollets (petits rus à traverser)
title: un vrai paradis
